statement: The system shall allow users to specify budget policies.
The system shall ensure that all provided information is as reliable as possible.
The system shall store a timestamp, the event itself, and any additional information required for the specific event.
The system shall allow all users to view the complete dataset.
The system shall allow guests to view final grain data.
The system shall allow unregistered users to view data related to the game results but not the budget period.
The system shall allow users to export data to journalists or press.
The system shall not support any kind of queries from the city and shall not allow such actions.
The system shall allow the team manager and team administration to review this data and perform offline analysis.
The system shall grant access to financial data to all users within the IFA finance department.
The system shall determine the appropriate policy.
The system shall consider the specified constraints when executing the scheduling algorithm.
The system shall provide guidance for allocating referees to games.
The system shall facilitate the definition of policies and based on those policies assign referees to games and enable referees to set their preferences.
The system shall allow manual adjustment of the schedule.
The system shall require confirmation of the change from another IFA representative.
The system shall require approval from two out of the IFA Scheduler levels.
The system shall enforce a minimum gap of either two days or one day between scheduling the next game.
The system shall allow users to define parameters.
The system shall provide experience improvements for the fans.
The system shall retrieve and process messages posted by players.
The system shall log and notify administrators of any unauthorized data collection events that occur in the game.
The system shall ensure coherence and reliability.
The system shall ensure that only referees and official channels can be the source of data about the games.
The system shall allow fans to register their specific areas of interest and then push them relevant information.
The system shall support the team manager to submit a report to the IFA once a year.
The system shall support simultaneous access by 50,000 people and ensure fast performance.
The system shall provide a response within a reasonable time period.
The system shall ensure the application responds very quickly in real time and prioritize its activities over other stadium activities.
The system shall notify the user upon connection of the referee to the system.
The system shall prioritize the user with high importance when they are in a game to ensure rapid event reporting.
The system shall support two-way communication with the referee.
The system shall notify the referee of any FAA-related information during or before or after the game.
The system shall delegate all storage and computing to external cloud service providers.
The system shall adjust to local regulations and reviews.
The system shall ensure that German data is not transferred outside the country in Germany.
The system shall register users for internet access to enable identification.
The system shall retain all past archives.
The system shall implement a recommendation engine for funds involved in gambling to reason about future outcomes.
The system shall store the data.
The system shall allow users to define the league, define the season, appoint a referee or register referees, set policies for the game budget, and schedule referee assignments.
